title: 103_hr4724
content: SECTION 1. ELIGIBILITY. Amends eligibility criteria for reservists discharged due to service-connected disability and surviving spouses of reservists who died while in active duty or service in the Selected Reserve. SEC. 2. Amends Section 3704 of title 38, United States Code by removing subsection (e) and redesignating subsections (f) and (g) as subsections (e) and (f), respectively. SEC. 3. Addresses refinancing loans. (a) Authority To Guarantee Home Refinance Loans for Energy Efficiency Improvements. Amends Section 3710 of title 38, United States Code to allow for refinancing existing loans for energy efficiency improvements. Includes a fee adjustment for such refinancing. (b) Refinancing Adjustable Rate Mortgages to Fixed Rate Mortgages. Amends Section 3710 of title 38 to address refinancing adjustable rate mortgages to fixed rate mortgages. Amendment to Section 3710(e)(1)(A) of title 38 allows for refinancing adjustable rate loans to fixed rate loans for veterans. SEC. 4. MANUFACTURED HOME LOAN INSPECTIONS. (a) Certification of Conformity With Standards.--Section 3712(h) of title 38, United States Code, is amended to state that any manufactured housing unit displaying certification of conformity to Federal standards shall be deemed to meet the required standards. (b) Repeal of Inspection Requirements.--Section 3712(j) is amended to remove inspection requirements related to manufactured homes not conforming to standards. The text chunk discusses amendments to certification and reporting requirements for manufactured homes under title 38, United States Code. It includes changes related to non-conforming homes and unfair practices by manufacturers. Reporting requirements are also eliminated. SEC. 5. PROCEDURES ON DEFAULT. In section 3732(c) of title 38, United States Code, amendments are made regarding the minimum amount for property sale at liquidation. The Secretary may accept conveyance of the property to the United States for a price not exceeding the minimum amount permitted by State law. Amendments are made to section 3732(c) of title 38, United States Code, allowing the option for property conveyance to the United States in return for payment by the Secretary. Amendments include changes to the minimum amount required for property sale at liquidation under State law. SEC. 6. MINIMUM ACTIVE-DUTY SERVICE REQUIREMENT. Amends Section 5303A(b)(3) of title 38, United States Code, to include benefits under chapter 37 for discharge or release from active duty due to a reduction in force. Passed the House of Representatives on August 1, 1994.
